summary:
## Beer Hall Putsch: A Failed Takeover

In 1923, Adolf Hitler and other Nazi leaders tried to seize power in Munich, Germany. They marched through the city, but police stopped them. Many people died in the fighting. Hitler escaped but was later arrested and sent to prison.

Although the takeover failed, it made Hitler famous. While in prison, he wrote a book called *Mein Kampf*. When he got out, he decided to gain power through elections instead of violence.
title: Beer Hall Putsch
